list.name: Default
list.comment: Fixed the simulator crashing (sometimes) when more than 3 lanes per road are chosen

task.summary: Default task
Fixed bug that was broke config-specified number of rows/columns of intersections
Now using AIM's built-in DataCollectionLines as checkpoints instead of my pink rectangle shapes that have to be manually placed for each road

Finished implementing the new checkpoint system that uses DataCollectionLines, made some general optimisations to improve performance, and fixed some bugs that should produce more accurate fitness scores for NEAT.
Now passing fitness score through an exponential function to prevent NEAT receiving nagative scores (since NEAT doesn't support negative fitness scores)

Passing score through exponential function wasn't working as anticipated, so the score variable now starts at 20000, such that deducting points should never cause it to drop below zero.
(this won't be used in the final fitness function though as it's too hacky)

On second thought: trying exponential method again.
This time, I'm adding/subtracting really small numbers to/from the score variable so that 2^(score) won't be too big.
Removed some try-catches that were put in place to protect the training process from simulator crashes (which are no longer an issue)
Updated the way training results are saved to disk (much neater now).
Updated the way training results are read from disk (much neater now).
Added some Encog NEAT parameters to config
Added some Encog NEAT parameters to config
config.txt is now copied to TrainingResults when a training session completes

Cars are too often 'cheating' by driving onto the grass to avoid collisions. So, I am now adding the average normalised distance from cars to the inside borders of the intersection to the score. If cars attempt to maximise this distance while inside the intersection (ie: try and stay close to the middle of the intersection while traversing it), then fitness scores will be higher.
* Added option to toggle drawing the field of view for each car's sensor during simulation. * Now experimenting with smaller sensor FOVs - results are significantly better thus far.

Changed some code in the moveVehicles() method in AutoDriverOnlySimulator such that vehicles are only registered as having passed checkpoints (DataCollectionLines) if they haven't had an accident. This way, DataCollectionLines can be used to measure throughput of the intersection - but ignoring all crashed vehicles.
Added option to make pedestrians stop walking and stand still in the intersection after some number of timesteps have passed.
added option to toggle AIM anti-crash heuristic (slow down for obstruction) to config
Added the following post-simulation statistics: * Percentage throughput of intersection * Average vehicle traversal time through intersection
Finally seem to have fixed a long-standing bug that, during NEAT simulations, prevented cars from exiting the intersection via any exit other than the one on the lane from which they entered.

Pedestrian code updated: Depending on the size of the intersection (which is a function of number of lanes), pedestrians walk between different random waypoints in different parts of the intersection, rather than the same two waypoints each new simulation (until the config is updated).

BIG COMMIT:
(1) Side sensors implemented (left and right). Each returns distance to nearest point on nearest detected obstruction.
(2) Optimised detection of obstructions in field of view. Simulations should be twice as fast now.
(3) Added multiple task trials per genome per generation during training (currently 5 per genome, but changeable) . (4) Fixed some bugs in my implementation of AIM's anti-collision heuristic.
Altered some code which produces throughput stats each task trial.

(1) fixed code that prevented the correct config of a given training session being saved to the correct folder
(2) added code that writes results stats to csv files in DemoResults directory
NEAT and AIM sensory configurations are now set automatically
Fixed the simulator crashing (sometimes) when more than 3 lanes per road are chosen

MESSAGE.value: Fixed bug that was broke config-specified number of rows/columns of intersections
Now using AIM's built-in DataCollectionLines as checkpoints instead of my pink rectangle shapes that have to be manually placed for each road

Finished implementing the new checkpoint system that uses DataCollectionLines, made some general optimisations to improve performance, and fixed some bugs that should produce more accurate fitness scores for NEAT.
Now passing fitness score through an exponential function to prevent NEAT receiving nagative scores (since NEAT doesn't support negative fitness scores)

Passing score through exponential function wasn't working as anticipated, so the score variable now starts at 20000, such that deducting points should never cause it to drop below zero.
(this won't be used in the final fitness function though as it's too hacky)

On second thought: trying exponential method again.
This time, I'm adding/subtracting really small numbers to/from the score variable so that 2^(score) won't be too big.
Removed some try-catches that were put in place to protect the training process from simulator crashes (which are no longer an issue)
Updated the way training results are saved to disk (much neater now).

Added some Encog NEAT parameters to config
config.txt is now copied to TrainingResults when a training session completes

Cars are too often 'cheating' by driving onto the grass to avoid collisions. So, I am now adding the average normalised distance from cars to the inside borders of the intersection to the score. If cars attempt to maximise this distance while inside the intersection (ie: try and stay close to the middle of the intersection while traversing it), then fitness scores will be higher.

This way, DataCollectionLines can be used to measure throughput of the intersection - but ignoring all crashed vehicles.

added option to toggle AIM anti-crash heuristic (slow down for obstruction) to config

Finally seem to have fixed a long-standing bug that, during NEAT simulations, prevented cars from exiting the intersection via any exit other than the one on the lane from which they entered.

Pedestrian code updated: Depending on the size of the intersection (which is a function of number of lanes), pedestrians walk between different random waypoints in different parts of the intersection, rather than the same two waypoints each new simulation (until the config is updated).

(1) Side sensors implemented (left and right). Each returns distance to nearest point on nearest detected obstruction.
(2) Optimised detection of obstructions in field of view. Simulations should be twice as fast now.
(3) Added multiple task trials per genome per generation during training (currently 5 per genome, but changeable) . (4) Fixed some bugs in my implementation of AIM's anti-collision heuristic.

option.name: LAST_COMMIT_MESSAGE
